description: This flavor-packed white bean soup is not only simple to make but also vegan and gluten-free, making it a perfect choice for everyone. Enjoy a warm bowl that will comfort your soul and delight your taste buds!
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, sauté until softened.
Stir in soaked white beans, vegetable broth, and thyme.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 25 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.
tips: For a creamier texture, blend a portion of the soup before serving. Adjust seasoning to taste for the best flavor.

structured_content.content: This white bean soup is a delightful blend of flavors that warms the heart and soul. With its creamy texture and rich taste, it's a dish that brings comfort and joy to any table.

structured_content.content: I remember the first time I made this soup; it was a chilly evening, and the aroma filled my kitchen, making it feel like home. Sharing it with friends made it even more special.

• Main ingredient: White beans are creamy and hearty, perfect for soups. Soak them overnight for best results.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Thyme adds a wonderful earthy flavor that complements the beans beautifully.
  • Supporting ingredients: Onion and garlic provide a savory base that enhances the overall taste.
  • Equipment needed: A large pot for cooking and a blender if you prefer a smoother texture.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Soak white beans overnight. Chop onion and mince garlic before starting.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Heat olive oil, sauté onion and garlic, add beans and broth, simmer until tender.
Finishing Touches:
Season with salt and pepper, serve hot with a drizzle of olive oil.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Simmering the beans gently ensures they remain intact and flavorful.
  • Avoid overcooking the beans to prevent mushiness.
  • The soup is ready when the beans are tender but not falling apart.
  • Store leftovers in the fridge for up to 3 days; reheat gently.

structured_content.content: This soup has become a family favorite, often enjoyed during gatherings. It's a dish that sparks joy and conversation around the table.
Enhance the soup with fresh herbs like parsley or basil, or add a splash of lemon juice for brightness. A pinch of red pepper flakes can add a nice kick!
Serve with crusty bread or a fresh salad for a complete meal. Pair with a light white wine for a delightful dining experience.
For a heartier version, add diced carrots and celery. To make it gluten-free, ensure your broth is certified gluten-free.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use homemade vegetable broth for the best flavor.
  • Soaking beans overnight enhances their texture and reduces cooking time.
  • Timing is key; check beans for doneness regularly.
  • Garnish with fresh herbs for an impressive presentation.
